item.title: Announcing multicloud assessments in Compliance Manager
item.description: Multicloud strategies have become the new norm for most enterprises, with over 90% of organizations adopting multiple cloud infrastructures (IaaS), platforms (PaaS), and services (SaaS) to run their businesses. However, a lack of visibility into this growing digital infrastructure exposes organizations to significant risks. As a customer, you may conduct business with Microsoft 365, run workloads on Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and Google Cloud (GCP), and rely on services like Zoom or Salesforce. item.title: Prevent data leak through web apps with Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention
item.description: The escalating prevalence of cyber threats and data breaches demands stringent measures to ensure data security. Exfiltrating sensitive information through personal emails or social media sites can not only expose sensitive data to hackers and lead to potential misuse. Implementing controls that restrict such actions provides an additional layer of security, reducing the risk of data leaks and fortifying the confidentiality of sensitive data. item.title: Manage insider risks in multicloud environments
item.description: The shift toward hybrid work environments has led to a significant increase in cloud service adoption in recent years. In fact, on average, organizations now use 147 public cloud services across SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS, compared with just 38 services in 2020*.
